command: [withheld] PowerShell executes cscript.exe with prnmngr.vbs using abnormal arguments that trigger an unrelated process creation (details redacted).
explanation: Leverages a signed printing admin script (prnmngr.vbs) to indirectly launch other processes, relying on the legitimacy of the script to evade application controls.
rationale_steps: Arguments to prnmngr.vbs include unexpected characters, quoting, or paths that are not part of normal printer management.
Downstream process creation from cscript.exe that is unrelated to printing operations.
Absence of matching print subsystem events in the event logs.
User context is a standard user without printer admin activity history.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: No concrete command string is provided (details withheld), so syntax, quoting, and flags cannot be verified and the snippet is not runnable as-is.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Invoking cscript.exe to run a signed admin VBS matches T1216 conceptually, but prnmngr.vbs is not generally known to support argument-driven arbitrary process execution, making the described behavior only partially plausible.

llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The described command perfectly aligns with T1216 (System Script Proxy Execution) by leveraging a legitimate signed script (prnmngr.vbs) via cscript.exe to proxy the execution of other processes, which is exactly how this technique works.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The actual command string is withheld, preventing any assessment of its syntactic structure or parseability as a runnable command.
